intro: Hymenostephium pilosulum, commonly known as the hairy hymenostephium, is a member of the Malvaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub characterized by its hairy stems and broad, ovate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Hymenostephium pilosulum is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
